titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1082
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1082

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

mw yhgl mʾt Γs˥rwrm ṣrfm w-kl mhwkb-hmw w-kl msqy-hmw w-kl
ṣwrt w-ʾrfd ʿdy ʾʿmdn w-ʾʿrśn w-kl ʾnhr w-bqlt ʿdy ʾʿmdn
w-kl ʾhdr mstqyn w-mštrʿn ʿdy ṭytn w-kl ṣΓw˥rt ḏ-qyhrn ḏ-t=
šʿww ʿdy šʾmt ʿdy hgrn lqṭ w-mkntn ṯmnt srwrm
w-kl mhwkb-hmw krrm w-šrʿ qšmtn w-ʾhdr-hΓw˥
w-ʾkfr-hw w-ṣwrt-hw w-kl mwsṭ hyt mknt
krrm w-ḥmdm b-ḏt nbl w-bltn b-ʿbr-hw gdrt
mlk ḥbštn l-tʾḫw b-ʿm-hw w-stkml hʾ ʾḫwnn
byn-hmw w-byn gdrt w-mṣr ʾḥbšn w-tgzmw k-wḥd ḍr-hm=
w-slm-hmw b-ʿl kl ḏ-ytΓšʾn˥ b-ʿbr-hmw w-k-b-ṣḥm w-ʾmnm ytʾ=
ḫwn slḥn w-zrrn w-ʿlhn w-gdrt kl ʿbrt-hmw w-ḥmdw b-ḏt
stkml ʾḫwn-hmw b-ʿm mlk ḥbštn ḥgn stkml ʾḫwn-hmw
b-ʿm ydʿʾb ġyln mlk ḥḍrmwt b-qdmy ḏt hqnytn w-ḥmd
Γm˥ b-ḏt stwfy kl ʾqwl w-mqtt nblw ʾysm b-ʿbr ʾḫ-hw b-bḥΓr˥m
Γw-˥ybsm w-kl tšʿt w-zbd ysrw ʾysm l-ʾḫ-hw w-ḥmdm b-ḏt tškrw
ʿmʾns bn śnḥn w-šʿbn ḫwln b-ḍr hštʾw w-tṭʿn b-ʿbr ʾmrʾ-=
hmw ʾmlk sbʾ w-b-ḏt bltw šbt bn ʿlyn b-ʿbr ḏ-rydn l-hnṣr-=

Text preserved in this squeeze:
5.[of Yahgal: 100] measures of ṣrf-incense-and (the completion of) [all of] their [pl]an[ta]tion and all of their irrigated land and every] 6.ṣwrt-plantation and (all of the) buttresses in the irrigated fields and [plan]tations [and all of the irrigation channels] and the plantings in the irrigated fields 7.and all of the water channels of the irrigation scheme and the irrigated land up to the [we]ll, and all of the ṣwrt-plantations of Qayharān which 8.[they had laid out(?) in the n]orth, as far as the town of Laqiṭ and the agricultural estate-eight measures- 9.[and all of] their p[la]nta[ti]on in its entirety(?) and the provisions of the vegetable plots and its water channels 10.[and] its cisterns and its irrigation apparatus and all of the furnishing of that agricultural estate 11.in sum total; and out of gratitude because he (i.e. Taʾlab Riyāmum) sent and dispatched to him Gadarat, 12.King of the Ethiopians, in order to establish an alliance with him. And that alliance was realized 13.[between] them and Gadara[t] and the army of the Ethiopians. And together they swore an oath as one, for war 14.and for peace, with regard to anyone who might rise up against them, and that with rectitude and fidelity they might 15.[main]tain the alliance of Salḥīn and Zarurān and ʿA[l]hān and Gadarat, each unto the other. And they expressed gratitude because 16.their alliance was realized with the king of the Ethiopians, just as their alliance 17.[with] Yadaʿʾab Ghaylān, King of Ḥaḍramawt, had been realized before this act of dedication; and out of gratitude 18.because he protected all of the qayls and lieutenants who were sent, one man unto his ally, at sea 19.and on land, and all dispatches and gifts which they sent, each man to his fellow; and out of gratitude because 20.[ʿAmmī]ʾanas bin Śinḥān and the tribe of Khawlān were defeated in a war which they had initiated and (through which) they had rebelled against 21.[their] lords, the kings of Sabaʾ, and because they sent Shabbat of (the clan of) ʿIlayyān to he of Raydān in order to aid 22.them (i.e. the Ḥimyarites) in a war against their lords, the kings of Sabaʾ, and some of the (Sabaean) confederation took the field to exact reprisals 23.on them in that war which they had initiated, and they vanquished some of Ḥaqlān and ravaged all of 24.its [terraced vineyards], and after that they surrendered to their lord ʿAlhān, the king of Sabaʾ, and they sent two 25.hostages: ʾAshmas bin Riyāmum and Ḥārith bin Yadīm. And may Taʾlab grant them prosperity 26.[and] good fortune and the destruction and humiliation of their enemies and their foes. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[ʿAlhān Nahfān and his son Shāʿirum ʾAwtar, King of Sabaʾ, son of Yar-] 2.[īm ʾAyman, King of Sabaʾ, have dedicated to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord of Tu-] 3.[rʿat, three statues of bronze, out of gratitude because Taʾlab granted them a favor] 4.[through the completion of all the (plantations of) ṭyb-incense and ṣrf-incense which they had laid out(?) and set up for their residence] 5.[of Yahgal: 100] measures of ṣrf-incense-and (the completion of) [all of] their [pl]an[ta]tion and all of their irrigated land and every] 6.ṣwrt-plantation and (all of the) buttresses in the irrigated fields and [plan]tations [and all of the irrigation channels] and the plantings in the irrigated fields 7.and all of the water channels of the irrigation scheme and the irrigated land up to the [we]ll, and all of the ṣwrt-plantations of Qayharān which 8.[they had laid out(?) in the n]orth, as far as the town of Laqiṭ and the agricultural estate-eight measures- 9.[and all of] their p[la]nta[ti]on in its entirety(?) and the provisions of the vegetable plots and its water channels 10.[and] its cisterns and its irrigation apparatus and all of the furnishing of that agricultural estate 11.in sum total; and out of gratitude because he (i.e. Taʾlab Riyāmum) sent and dispatched to him Gadarat, 12.King of the Ethiopians, in order to establish an alliance with him. And that alliance was realized 13.[between] them and Gadara[t] and the army of the Ethiopians. And together they swore an oath as one, for war 14.and for peace, with regard to anyone who might rise up against them, and that with rectitude and fidelity they might 15.[main]tain the alliance of Salḥīn and Zarurān and ʿA[l]hān and Gadarat, each unto the other. And they expressed gratitude because 16.their alliance was realized with the king of the Ethiopians, just as their alliance 17.[with] Yadaʿʾab Ghaylān, King of Ḥaḍramawt, had been realized before this act of dedication; and out of gratitude 18.because he protected all of the qayls and lieutenants who were sent, one man unto his ally, at sea 19.and on land, and all dispatches and gifts which they sent, each man to his fellow; and out of gratitude because 20.[ʿAmmī]ʾanas bin Śinḥān and the tribe of Khawlān were defeated in a war which they had initiated and (through which) they had rebelled against 21.[their] lords, the kings of Sabaʾ, and because they sent Shabbat of (the clan of) ʿIlayyān to he of Raydān in order to aid 22.them (i.e. the Ḥimyarites) in a war against their lords, the kings of Sabaʾ, and some of the (Sabaean) confederation took the field to exact reprisals 23.on them in that war which they had initiated, and they vanquished some of Ḥaqlān and ravaged all of 24.its [terraced vineyards], and after that they surrendered to their lord ʿAlhān, the king of Sabaʾ, and they sent two 25.hostages: ʾAshmas bin Riyāmum and Ḥārith bin Yadīm. And may Taʾlab grant them prosperity 26.[and] good fortune and the destruction and humiliation of their enemies and their foes. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
of Yahgal:
measures of ṣrf-incense-and the completion of all of their plantation and all of their irrigated land and every
ṣwrt-plantation and all of the buttresses in the irrigated fields and plantations and all of the irrigation channels and the plantings in the irrigated fields
and all of the water channels of the irrigation scheme and the irrigated land up to the well, and all of the ṣwrt-plantations of Qayharān which
they had laid out? in the north, as far as the town of Laqiṭ and the agricultural estate-eight measures-
and all of their plantation in its entirety? and the provisions of the vegetable plots and its water channels
and its cisterns and its irrigation apparatus and all of the furnishing of that agricultural estate
in sum total; and out of gratitude because he i.e. Taʾlab Riyāmum sent and dispatched to him Gadarat,
King of the Ethiopians, in order to establish an alliance with him. And that alliance was realized
between them and Gadarat and the army of the Ethiopians. And together they swore an oath as one, for war
and for peace, with regard to anyone who might rise up against them, and that with rectitude and fidelity they might
maintain the alliance of Salḥīn and Zarurān and ʿAlhān and Gadarat, each unto the other. And they expressed gratitude because
their alliance was realized with the king of the Ethiopians, just as their alliance
with Yadaʿʾab Ghaylān, King of Ḥaḍramawt, had been realized before this act of dedication; and out of gratitude
because he protected all of the qayls and lieutenants who were sent, one man unto his ally, at sea
and on land, and all dispatches and gifts which they sent, each man to his fellow; and out of gratitude because
ʿAmmīʾanas bin Śinḥān and the tribe of Khawlān were defeated in a war which they had initiated and through which they had rebelled against
their lords, the kings of Sabaʾ, and because they sent Shabbat of the clan of ʿIlayyān to he of Raydān in order to aid
them i.e. the Ḥimyarites in a war against their lords, the kings of Sabaʾ, and some of the Sabaean confederation took the field to exact reprisals
on them in that war which they had initiated, and they vanquished some of Ḥaqlān and ravaged all of
its terraced vineyards, and after that they surrendered to their lord ʿAlhān, the king of Sabaʾ, and they sent two
hostages: ʾAshmas bin Riyāmum and Ḥārith bin Yadīm. And may Taʾlab grant them prosperity
and good fortune and the destruction and humiliation of their enemies and their foes. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.
Restored full text of the inscription:
ʿAlhān Nahfān and his son Shāʿirum ʾAwtar, King of Sabaʾ, son of Yar-
īm ʾAyman, King of Sabaʾ, have dedicated to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord of Tu-
rʿat, three statues of bronze, out of gratitude because Taʾlab granted them a favor
through the completion of all the plantations of ṭyb-incense and ṣrf-incense which they had laid out? and set up for their residence
of Yahgal:
measures of ṣrf-incense-and the completion of all of their plantation and all of their irrigated land and every
ṣwrt-plantation and all of the buttresses in the irrigated fields and plantations and all of the irrigation channels and the plantings in the irrigated fields
and all of the water channels of the irrigation scheme and the irrigated land up to the well, and all of the ṣwrt-plantations of Qayharān which
they had laid out? in the north, as far as the town of Laqiṭ and the agricultural estate-eight measures-
and all of their plantation in its entirety? and the provisions of the vegetable plots and its water channels
and its cisterns and its irrigation apparatus and all of the furnishing of that agricultural estate
in sum total; and out of gratitude because he i.e. Taʾlab Riyāmum sent and dispatched to him Gadarat,
King of the Ethiopians, in order to establish an alliance with him. And that alliance was realized
between them and Gadarat and the army of the Ethiopians. And together they swore an oath as one, for war
and for peace, with regard to anyone who might rise up against them, and that with rectitude and fidelity they might
maintain the alliance of Salḥīn and Zarurān and ʿAlhān and Gadarat, each unto the other. And they expressed gratitude because
their alliance was realized with the king of the Ethiopians, just as their alliance
with Yadaʿʾab Ghaylān, King of Ḥaḍramawt, had been realized before this act of dedication; and out of gratitude
because he protected all of the qayls and lieutenants who were sent, one man unto his ally, at sea
and on land, and all dispatches and gifts which they sent, each man to his fellow; and out of gratitude because
ʿAmmīʾanas bin Śinḥān and the tribe of Khawlān were defeated in a war which they had initiated and through which they had rebelled against
their lords, the kings of Sabaʾ, and because they sent Shabbat of the clan of ʿIlayyān to he of Raydān in order to aid
them i.e. the Ḥimyarites in a war against their lords, the kings of Sabaʾ, and some of the Sabaean confederation took the field to exact reprisals
on them in that war which they had initiated, and they vanquished some of Ḥaqlān and ravaged all of
its terraced vineyards, and after that they surrendered to their lord ʿAlhān, the king of Sabaʾ, and they sent two
hostages: ʾAshmas bin Riyāmum and Ḥārith bin Yadīm. And may Taʾlab grant them prosperity
and good fortune and the destruction and humiliation of their enemies and their foes. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

between them and Gadarat and the army of the Ethiopians. And together they swore an oath as one, for war
and for peace, with regard to anyone who might rise up against them, and that with rectitude and fidelity they might
maintain the alliance of Salḥīn and Zarurān and ʿAlhān and Gadarat, each unto the other. And they expressed gratitude because
their alliance was realized with the king of the Ethiopians, just as their alliance
with Yadaʿʾab Ghaylān, King of Ḥaḍramawt, had been realized before this act of dedication; and out of gratitude
because he protected all of the qayls and lieutenants who were sent, one man unto his ally, at sea
and on land, and all dispatches and gifts which they sent, each man to his fellow; and out of gratitude because
ʿAmmīʾanas bin Śinḥān and the tribe of Khawlān were defeated in a war which they had initiated and through which they had rebelled against
their lords, the kings of Sabaʾ, and because they sent Shabbat of the clan of ʿIlayyān to he of Raydān in order to aid
them i.e. the Ḥimyarites in a war against their lords, the kings of Sabaʾ, and some of the Sabaean confederation took the field to exact reprisals
on them in that war which they had initiated, and they vanquished some of Ḥaqlān and ravaged all of
its terraced vineyards, and after that they surrendered to their lord ʿAlhān, the king of Sabaʾ, and they sent two
hostages: ʾAshmas bin Riyāmum and Ḥārith bin Yadīm. And may Taʾlab grant them prosperity
and good fortune and the destruction and humiliation of their enemies and their foes. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
of Yahgal:

ṣwrt-plantation and all of the buttresses in the irrigated fields and plantations and all of the irrigation channels and the plantings in the irrigated fields
and all of the water channels of the irrigation scheme and the irrigated land up to the well, and all of the ṣwrt-plantations of Qayharān which
they had laid out? in the north, as far as the town of Laqiṭ and the agricultural estate-eight measures-
and all of their plantation in its entirety? and the provisions of the vegetable plots and its water channels
and its cisterns and its irrigation apparatus and all of the furnishing of that agricultural estate
in sum total; and out of gratitude because he i.e. Taʾlab Riyāmum sent and dispatched to him Gadarat,
King of the Ethiopians, in order to establish an alliance with him. And that alliance was realized
between them and Gadarat and the army of the Ethiopians. And together they swore an oath as one, for war
and for peace, with regard to anyone who might rise up against them, and that with rectitude and fidelity they might
maintain the alliance of Salḥīn and Zarurān and ʿAlhān and Gadarat, each unto the other. And they expressed gratitude because

and on land, and all dispatches and gifts which they sent, each man to his fellow; and out of gratitude because

and good fortune and the destruction and humiliation of their enemies and their foes. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.
Restored full text of the inscription:
ʿAlhān Nahfān and his son Shāʿirum ʾAwtar, King of Sabaʾ, son of Yar-
īm ʾAyman, King of Sabaʾ, have dedicated to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord of Tu-
rʿat, three statues of bronze, out of gratitude because Taʾlab granted them a favor
through the completion of all the plantations of ṭyb-incense and ṣrf-incense which they had laid out? and set up for their residence
of Yahgal:
measures of ṣrf-incense-and the completion of all of their plantation and all of their irrigated land and every
ṣwrt-plantation and all of the buttresses in the irrigated fields and plantations and all of the irrigation channels and the plantings in the irrigated fields
and all of the water channels of the irrigation scheme and the irrigated land up to the well, and all of the ṣwrt-plantations of Qayharān which
they had laid out? in the north, as far as the town of Laqiṭ and the agricultural estate-eight measures-
and all of their plantation in its entirety? and the provisions of the vegetable plots and its water channels
and its cisterns and its irrigation apparatus and all of the furnishing of that agricultural estate
in sum total; and out of gratitude because he i.e. Taʾlab Riyāmum sent and dispatched to him Gadarat,
King of the Ethiopians, in order to establish an alliance with him. And that alliance was realized
between them and Gadarat and the army of the Ethiopians. And together they swore an oath as one, for war
and for peace, with regard to anyone who might rise up against them, and that with rectitude and fidelity they might
maintain the alliance of Salḥīn and Zarurān and ʿAlhān and Gadarat, each unto the other. And they expressed gratitude because
their alliance was realized with the king of the Ethiopians, just as their alliance
with Yadaʿʾab Ghaylān, King of Ḥaḍramawt, had been realized before this act of dedication; and out of gratitude
because he protected all of the qayls and lieutenants who were sent, one man unto his ally, at sea
and on land, and all dispatches and gifts which they sent, each man to his fellow; and out of gratitude because
ʿAmmīʾanas bin Śinḥān and the tribe of Khawlān were defeated in a war which they had initiated and through which they had rebelled against
their lords, the kings of Sabaʾ, and because they sent Shabbat of the clan of ʿIlayyān to he of Raydān in order to aid
them i.e. the Ḥimyarites in a war against their lords, the kings of Sabaʾ, and some of the Sabaean confederation took the field to exact reprisals
on them in that war which they had initiated, and they vanquished some of Ḥaqlān and ravaged all of
its terraced vineyards, and after that they surrendered to their lord ʿAlhān, the king of Sabaʾ, and they sent two
hostages: ʾAshmas bin Riyāmum and Ḥārith bin Yadīm. And may Taʾlab grant them prosperity
and good fortune and the destruction and humiliation of their enemies and their foes. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.
